title: 4/2.5 2500sf Townhouse on Dickinson Square To Rent 8/22-7/23 (Only)
description:
2500 square foot, 4 bedroom, 2.5 bath house with tall ceilings, wood floors and central air on Dickinson Square park for rent from August 2022 to July 2023. We're looking for someone to rent our family home as we're away for a year. No continuation of lease or shorter term considered. We can be flexible by days or weeks. First, last and security before move in. Absolutely NO SMOKERS or SMOKING in the house.
Possibly full or partially furnished if you're interested, but not required. The unobtrusively placed piano will stay. Nearby go-to contact for any problems, or we're able to return within days. We love our house. We want you to love it too. Kids or families or friends of any situation (along with house-trained pets) welcomed. The catchment elementary school is Kirkbride, which is a lovely school community. Free street parking is relatively easy given the park.
Walk in to an open living/dining room. Behind is an open entry to the new kitchen. Second floor is 2 bedrooms, a full bath, a laundry room with tons of storage and a closet. The third floor is a rear bedroom and a gigantic master suite. In between is a large master bath with jacuzzi tub. The rear bedrooms along with the living and dining room had their original oak floors restored. The kitchen has doubled in size and is brand new.
The front bedrooms are huge and both designed as master suites. They overlook the park and are filled with morning light. The 3rd floor rear bedroom has broad westerly views and insane light. The neighbors are lovely. The Delaware River trail is a 5 minute walk. Biking or transiting downtown is under 10 minutes. There are myriad food and drink options in the neighborhood, or take a quick walk to Passyunk. Multiple grocery stores and Target also a quick walk.
We're happy to answer questions about the house, the neighborhood, schools, etc. Or come by and see it and ask questions in person! If you're out of town we can give you a video walk through. Applications accepted through Zillow. We wish you all luck in your search! Thanks.
Please no contact from agents nor property managers, thank you.

title: Spacious and Bright 1bd/1ba in Spruce Hill/U City avail August 1st
description:
Recently renovated, large 1bd/1ba apartment in the heart of Spruce Hill. Here’s more details about the place, neighborhood, and timing. If you’re interested just book some time with us for a video chat (links below).
THE APARTMENT:
The apartment is a third floor unit with tons of sunlight on a lovely tree lined block. The apartment has a separate entrance through the back up 2 flights of stairs.  A very spacious living room, newly refinished hardwood floors, brand new kitchen appliances and updated windows.
1 Bedroom, 1 Bath, 700sq ft total
Great hardwood floors throughout.
Large eat in kitchen with brand new refrigerator and gas stove/oven.  Plenty of counter top space and cabinets.  Countertop microwave and small pantry.
All utilities included – water, gas, electric.  (Tenant is responsible for internet and cable if needed)
There is plenty of resident street parking in the neighborhood
THE LOCATION
Residential University City location on a lovely tree-lined street in Spruce Hill – only 1 block away from Clark Park and Baltimore Ave. It’s only 400 feet from the 34 Trolley as well as an easy stroll to all the restaurants, coffee shops and bars on Baltimore Ave.  Close by food shopping at Clark Park Farmers Market, Spruce Hill Provisions, or Mariposa Food Co-op.
Quick walk to Knock box Cafe, The Greenline Café, Clarkville, Local 44, Bottleshop, TacoTaco Mexican, Pop Shop, CVS, and much more. Walk to HUP, Penn, CHOP, Penn Vet, Drexel, and University of the Sciences.  12 minutes to Rittenhouse Square by car and plenty of SEPTA options.
THE LEASE:
Rent: $1350 / month
Term: 1 year lease, starting August 1st (we can be flexible on start date)
If mutually agreed, you can renew/extend the duration of your lease.
Utilities: Includes garbage, water, gas, and electricity. You just need to set up/pay for internet and any cable access needed.
Pets: No pets allowed.
To move in: First, last and security deposit. First month's rent ($1350) + last month’s rent ($1350) + Security Deposit ($1350) = $4050.
Standard Pennsylvania lease agreement
INTERESTED?
If you're interested, we're doing quick 15 minute Zoom chats the next couple weeks to meet folks. To book your 15 minute chat, just click here and pick a spot on the calendar. https://calendly.com/44thstreet
After the video chat, you can come by the apartment to check it out for yourself. We’re doing apartment showings on weekends with some weekday evening times as well.
If this ad is still up, the apartment is still available. Hope to meet you soon!

title: Beautiful Rennovated Historic House - Yard, Fireplace, Cooks Kitchen
description:
Beautiful historic rowhouse in Washington Square West, Center City, on small pedestrian street, off of 10th and Spruce Streets. Cars and trucks can drive on the street to make moving and shopping easy, but there is no parking on the street, which preserves the quaint historic vibe.
This home is well maintained by the owners who used to live there. The house was renovated in 2012, and improvements are made each year.
Central air, backyard, security system with smart locks. 3 bedrooms, living room, family room, kitchen, dining room. Full bath and powder room. Washer and Dryer.
August 15 move in date, flexible.
Walking distance to everything Center City has to offer: Jefferson Hospital, University of Pennsylvania Hospital, Wills Eye Hospital, Washington Square Park, Old City, Ritz Movie theater, restaurants, shops, dog park, grocery stores, the Walnut and Forrest Theaters.

Why is it so hard to get into an apartment. I’m a hard working person I had to come back to Oregon because my mom is on hospice. Yet I have to live in my car. Any affordable leads would be appreciated. Hello Portland! My name is Monica. I recently got to Portland after 9 years abroad teaching English and studying Eastern Culture (I love India and Nepal!). I also spent a few years in Mexico. Hablo espanole si quieres practicar conmigo! Mi espanole no es lo mejor pero podemos practicar! :) If you rent me a room I will give you unlimited free Spanish lessons. Bring your friends! Free for everyone.
My story is weird. I am supposed to be in Buenos Aires finally starting my English school/ art gallery for marginalized communities, but I had to return to the USA for a dental implant! I had a bad horseback accident a year ago, my front tooth was knocked clean out! I am in Portland to get good quality medical care. It is the ONLY reason I am in the USA. The process will take about one year, as the healing periods between surgeries are super long. I would not be a bedridden smelly sad sack in your house though, the facial swelling only lasts a week after each surgery. In a year, I will have my magic teeth and can leave this rotting land of avarice.
My first surgery will be in a few weeks. I am still teaching online, will be getting a job at a shelter soon. After 5 continents and 30 countries, I have never been anywhere as dynamically and needlessly tragic as Portland. So much suffering, so many people lost in a broken system. And a general populace that claims impotence. C'mon y'all, this is downright shameful. This country has gone to total shit, legal weed is cool though.
During some post op healing periods, I will not be working. My father can personally guarantee that my rent will be paid, and he would be happy to talk with a prospective renter on the phone. He is paying for all rent I cannot cover and all rent/medical for the coming year.
I love teaching, yoga, fitness, meditation, books, hiking, camping and sometimes 420. Not much drinking anymore, never wasted. I must admit I am a psychonaut (every few months or so to gain perspective). I am fairly solitary and aside from art projects and lots of adventures, I am usually reading.
I would be happy to rent a room, garage, trailer (I mean, tiny house. Sorry Portland, haha) I would even be happy to rent a tent space in your back yard! I can pay up to 900 per month for whatever I end up renting. I have not driven in 17 years and don't plan on it. I skateboard and bicycle a lot though.
Hello! Middle aged who is employed full time looking for a long term platonic non furnished room for rent. Starting over after divorce and struggling with today’s housing costs. I am looking for something safe and reliable for myself and my medium sized well behaved dog sometime around July 23rd. We are clean, quiet, and keep to ourselves and appreciate any serious replies.
lets look for a place to rent together (Vancouver wa)
dogs are OK - wooof
hi I'm looking for a roommate someone who wants to look for a place to rent together split rent and utilities.im hoping for something around 800 to 900 max.
Hello, I'm a young looking to rent a room in a specific part of Portland Oregon. I've recently stayed in hostels so I fully understand communal living and being considerate of roommates. I'm quite easy going friendly and generally keep my opinions to myself. Conscious & considerate of other people is absolutely how I would describe myself. I'm 420 friendly, enjoy an occasionally glass of wine and watching tv shows in my room. I enjoy going to the gym, hiking and being outdoors doing things when I have the time. I do have a job and cash saved so rent/utilities wont be an issue. I'm more than ok with shared chores & nessecities. I love pets but currently dont have any. I'm looking to rent somewhere near the Matt Dishman Community Center and the near the Red Robin. I think Id be a great fit as your hopeful future roommate.
Quiet, responsible, and respectful & trustworthy middle aged couple with 15 pound corgi terrier, seeking small rental. We currently reside in & have been in Southern Oregon 12 years.
Excellent references!
(We have never paid rent late one time in all this time)
We host/produce a national & syndicated FM radio show ( for 23 years now) & are into gardening, music, reading, Tai Chi & metaphysics.
Hello there so I am looking for a nice clean room available to rent but only for about a month. I'm looking to pay around $400. I am currently unemployed but am seeking employment at this time. I just need a safe, stable, and clean room to rent to lay my head at night. I am a single 37yr old and not looking for a relationship nor am I any kind of prostitute. I was renting a room from a friend but their situation has changed so they are moving out so I'm having to go as well. please email me but only serious inquiries. thank you

Why is it so hard to get into an apartment. I’m a hard working person I had to come back to Oregon because my mom is on hospice. Yet I have to live in my car. Any affordable leads would be appreciated. Hello Portland! My name is Monica. I recently got to Portland after 9 years abroad teaching English and studying Eastern Culture (I love India and Nepal!). I also spent a few years in Mexico. Hablo espanole si quieres practicar conmigo! Mi espanole no es lo mejor pero podemos practicar! :) If you rent me a room I will give you unlimited free Spanish lessons. Bring your friends! Free for everyone.
My story is weird. I am supposed to be in Buenos Aires finally starting my English school/ art gallery for marginalized communities, but I had to return to the USA for a dental implant! I had a bad horseback accident a year ago, my front tooth was knocked clean out! I am in Portland to get good quality medical care. It is the ONLY reason I am in the USA. The process will take about one year, as the healing periods between surgeries are super long. I would not be a bedridden smelly sad sack in your house though, the facial swelling only lasts a week after each surgery. In a year, I will have my magic teeth and can leave this rotting land of avarice.
My first surgery will be in a few weeks. I am still teaching online, will be getting a job at a shelter soon. After 5 continents and 30 countries, I have never been anywhere as dynamically and needlessly tragic as Portland. So much suffering, so many people lost in a broken system. And a general populace that claims impotence. C'mon y'all, this is downright shameful. This country has gone to total shit, legal weed is cool though.
During some post op healing periods, I will not be working. My father can personally guarantee that my rent will be paid, and he would be happy to talk with a prospective renter on the phone. He is paying for all rent I cannot cover and all rent/medical for the coming year.
I love teaching, yoga, fitness, meditation, books, hiking, camping and sometimes 420. Not much drinking anymore, never wasted. I must admit I am a psychonaut (every few months or so to gain perspective). I am fairly solitary and aside from art projects and lots of adventures, I am usually reading.
I would be happy to rent a room, garage, trailer (I mean, tiny house. Sorry Portland, haha) I would even be happy to rent a tent space in your back yard! I can pay up to 900 per month for whatever I end up renting. I have not driven in 17 years and don't plan on it. I skateboard and bicycle a lot though.

I'm a tattoo artist moving back to New York during mid September. I'm looking for a one bedroom or studio ranging from 900 to 1500. I can do first month and security deposit. Prefer to have laundry in unit. I know this is a little in advance, but I'm looking for something to be set up already so I don't waste my time looking for someplace. We daycare small children from 9-6. My Husband drives the van for the pick up’s and drop offs. 15 years same address. No eviction or rent, police issues, no parties. Spacious 1br apartment with in-unit washer and dryer which makes life easier when you are busy with work and having summer fun. Great kitchen with stainless steel appliances, granite counters, and dishwasher. A fresh bathroom that is larger than standard. The apartment has a nice layout where you can even create your own office space if you ever work from home. It is in an elevator building with access to storage in the basement. By appointment only, let us rent your apartment like our Company has been doing for over 40 years now. James Turano Inc Open to all sexes , need pictures of the place in first email ( if you cannot send via email please do not respond- I am not asking for an address just pictures ) also provide a price in the FIRST email- this cuts back the back and forth . I am late 30’s , teacher that is transitioning to another career so things are up in the air , 420 friendly, and stay in my room when home . Not looking to be best friends with roomate . My room must have a lock . Price range is 750-950 I am looking for a cottage or small single family house that is DOG friendly for my mom. Her lease has ended so she needs to move asap. Her Maltese is a barker so preferably no apartments. Its just her and her dogs. She is able to afford $2800 a month. Maybe even $3000 with my help. She gets rental assistance through a permanent housing program which pays for most to all of the rent. They also pay one months rent and security and realtor fee. Preferably in westchester or Putnam or even around hopewell junction. Looking for a room that’s clean, modern and close to public transportation. I’m gay, 43, Latin American (black) , American born , raised and educated. I always pay rent and bills on time and will delete my ad once I’ve found a place. I don’t want to live with cats , roaches or mice . Lol sorry. I also smoke so if there’s no amok in the house then pls let me know if there’s a backyard or rooftop pls . I’m not a partier , I’m pretty easy going and def like my privacy but can also be social. Pls .. Pls .. no sexual stuff when u reply and no games pls. I posted and got alot of weirdos and inn appropriate replies . If u reply pls let me know rent , the set , location and whatever other details necessary. Thanks and have a blessed Day I have a client who needs to visit Manhattan only on Wednesday and Thursday nights for approximately 6 months and I need to accommodate her stay in the city on a consistent basis (every week). It may be a good fit for you if you travel during the business days and have your apartment sitting empty during that time or if you are also interested in sharing one of your spare rooms for just two days a week while it could bring you extra income. Hi there. I'm a longtime New Yorker whose life was briefly derailed last Fall by medical issues and a flooded apartment (the roof of my Bushwick apt. caved in during Hurricane Ida) so I've been living upstate for nine months and am looking to move back to the city in August or September. I can pay up to $1500/month. I work in publishing (primarily remotely) and am laid-back, quiet, responsible, and considerate. I'm also very friendly and social and get out and about quite a bit. Nothing much bothers me (believe me, I've seen it all and really been through it in terms of apartment problems, etc). I lived alone for a long time but almost bankrupted myself; that's why I'm looking for a roommate now. I'm a in my late 20s and my lease is up at my current place in Bushwick, but I found an apartment for Aug 1st, so I'm in need of a July sublet for one month! I'm a manager at a bar, so I'm usually pretty busy and just want somewhere to come home to while I get ready to move into my new place. I'm looking for somewhere in Bushwick or Williamsburg and less than $1000. PM me if you know of anything!!

Upstairs, a large and light-filled owner's suite sits at the front of floor two, which boasts the same striking hardwood flooring. A second spacious bedroom and full bath complete this floor. 2012 offers unique flexibility, as floor three of the home boasts a third expansive bedroom which might also be an owner's suite. Up a quick flight to sweeping panoramic city skyline views and tremendous open-air entertainment space from the fabulous rooftop deck. Expanding the home's value exponentially, the lower level is completely and beautifully finished, replete with a higher ceiling, comfortable living area, spacious bedroom and full bath, excellent storage, and laundry. Simply an exceptional, loved property in every way, in a walkable neighborhood surrounded by art and culture, fine and casual dining, shopping, easy access to transportation, the schuylkill river trail, fairmount park, and so much more. title: Renovated and Charming 4 bedroom, 2 bath Cape Style home!!!
description: E Huntingdon St, Welcome to 2038 E Huntingdon! This spacious East Kensington home beautifully blends form and function, filled with custom fine woodwork and artistic details in an abundance of space. As you approach this 3-story rowhome your eye will be immediately drawn to the flower boxes and custom planter with bench out front. The first level has an open floorplan, smoothly flowing from living room to dining room to kitchen, all with great natural light. Built-in shelves allow for functional and attractive storage for books, plants or your favorite treasures. In the kitchen, additional custom built-in shelving over the ample counter space smartly allows for more attractive and accessible storage without sacrificing the natural light from the large kitchen window. You can grill, entertain and dine al fresco with ease as you pass through the kitchen back door to a covered deck and spacious back yard, ready for any and all outdoor activities you desire. Back inside, head upstairs past the lovely hand-painted mural and fine handcrafted balusters to the 2nd level which houses 2 bedrooms, a full hall bathroom and hall closet. The rear bedroom with new hardwood flooring was most recently used as a textiles studio but can easily be used as a regular bedroom, office, nursery or guest room. The renovated hall bath has clever custom built-in storage for easily accessible but well-hidden extra necessities as well as handsome and unique fixtures. Pass the hall closet to the spacious front bedroom with double wide closet and dressing area. From there, head up to the 3rd level to find an additional small room that would be perfect for an office or nursey, a half bath and another full bedroom with double wide closet. With this charming house you can have the often-elusive combination of a big yard without sacrificing all the perks of city living. It’s an easy walk to the Kensington Co-op, coffee shops, restaurants and public trans while also being close to I-95 for driving convenience.  Please mention your phone number.

description:
Step outside to endless options for your every need! Welcome to the ellington 10d. This one-bedroom, one-bathroom condo combines great open space with lots of natural light and modern amenities. A beautiful white kitchen with granite counters, features stainless upgraded appliances and leads to a spacious living area with high ceilings and sleek wood floors. The bedroom is oversized and the sunny window nook is the perfect place for a home office or relaxing seating area. A spacious bathroom is outfitted in marble, and has a combination tub and shower. In-unit laundry is located just off of the kitchen area, and ample storage is found throughout. The ellington offers a resident’s lounge, 24-hour doorperson, on-site fitness center, and is conveniently located just steps from incredible dining options like mission, giuseppe & sons, harp & crown, oyster house, del frisco’s, and so many more. Enjoy the surrounding rittenhouse shopping district, and enjoy the conveniences of nearby public transportation and nightlife. Enjoy this incredible value while it lasts, whether for yourself, or as an investment opportunity!
1500 chestnut st #10d,
